sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"迅速，急速"之意。
means: haste ： 中性词，用作褒义指动作迅速，事情做得又快又好；作贬义用时，指做事急躁，行为鲁莽，得不到预期的结果。
speed ： 多用于褒义，指行动敏捷快速，效果好。
hurry ： 指急速从事某项活动或匆忙对付一件事情，含明显慌乱的意味。
dispatch ： 指迅速、敏捷地结事某事，强调敏捷和及时。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"速度，速率"之意。
means: speed ： 普通用词，指单位时间内行进的固定速度或速率，也指可能达到的最高速度。
rate作"速度"讲时，与speed同义，可换用。作速率解时，指相对增长的速度，也指两种相比较而得出的标准速度。
velocity ： 技术用词，指物体沿着一定方向运动时的速率。
pace ： 普通用词，指步行的速度，常引申指活动的进度或生产率。

word_mean: 舰船在单位时间内航行的距离。

sentence.Network_en: He pushed everyone full speed ahead until production hit a bottleneck.
sentence.Network_cn: 他催促所有人拼命干活，直到生产遭遇瓶颈。

sentence.Network_en: The camera combines rugged reliability with unequalled optical performance and speed.
sentence.Network_cn: 这款相机既坚固耐用，又有超凡的光学性能和快门速度。

sentence.Network_en: It all started so promisingly when Speed scored a tremendous first goal.
sentence.Network_cn: 比赛开始的时候形势大好，斯皮德以一记精彩的进球拔得头筹。

PerfectNetExp.abs: ...感人心者，莫先乎情“。要想赢得顾客的人，必先投之以情，用真情服务感化顾客，以有情服务赢得无情的竞争。, 2、速度(speed), 指不让顾客久等，而能迅速的接待、办理。.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English spēd (noun), spēdan (verb), from the Germanic base of Old English spōwan 'prosper, succeed', a sense reflected in early usage

encyclopedia.content: SPEED是日本流行音乐史上，以平均年龄12.5岁出道的年轻少女组合。SPEED随着《一吻定情》这部人气日剧红遍亚洲。由四个美少女组成：主音岛袋宽子、今井绘理子，合音...

entry.def: The speed of something is the rate at which it moves or travels.

example.ex: He drove off at high speed...
With this type of camera, the shutter speed is fixed...
example.tran: 对这类相机而言，快门的速度是固定的。

entry.tran: (某事发生或进展的)速度，进度
entry.def: The speed of something is the rate at which it happens or is done.

example.ex: In the late 1850s the speed of technological change quickened...
example.tran: 19 世纪 50 年代末期，技术变革的速度加快了。

example.ex: Each learner can proceed at his own speed.
example.tran: 每一位学习者都可以按自己的进度学习。

entry.def: Speed is very fast movement or travel.

example.ex: Speed is the essential ingredient of all athletics...
example.tran: 速度是所有田径运动项目的关键要素。

example.ex: He put on a burst of speed...

entry.tran: (指某事发生或进展时的)高速，快速
entry.def: Speed is a very fast rate at which something happens or is done.

example.ex: I was amazed at his speed of working.
example.tran: 他办事之麻利让我深感叹服。

example.ex: ...the sheer speed of the unification process.

entry.def: If you speed somewhere, you move or travel there quickly, usually in a vehicle.

example.ex: Trains will speed through the Channel Tunnel at 186mph...
example.tran: 火车将以每小时 186 英里的速度快速穿过海峡隧道。

example.ex: The engine noise rises only slightly as I speed along.
example.tran: 我一路高速行驶时，发动机的噪音只提高了一点点。

entry.def: Someone who is speeding is driving a vehicle faster than the legal speed limit.

example.ex: This man was not qualified to drive and was speeding.
example.tran: 这名男子没有驾驶资格，并且违章超速行驶。

entry.def: Speed is an illegal drug such as amphetamine which some people take to increase their energy and excitement.
If you are up to speed, you have all the most recent information that you need about something.

example.ex: A day has been set aside to bring all councillors up to speed on the proposal...
example.tran: 已经确定了一个日子，届时将向所有的市政委员汇报有关该建议的最新进展情况。

example.ex: Those in charge deluded themselves they were up to speed.
example.tran: 那些负责人自以为掌握了最新情况。

means.word_mean: 2. a rate (usually rapid) at which something happens;
4. the ratio of the focal length to the diameter of a (camera) lens system
5. a central nervous system stimulant that increases energy and decreases appetite; used to treat narcolepsy and some forms of depression

sentences.sentence: "He rushed down the hall to receive his guests"

means.word_mean: 3. travel at an excessive or illegal velocity;

sentences.sentence: "The runner zipped past us at breakneck speed"

example.en: Tom is a speed demon. He qualified for the Olympics.
example.zh: 汤姆奔跑速度极快。他有资格参加奥林匹克运动比赛

example.en: Bruno has been a demon since he was eighteen.
example.zh: 布鲁诺从18岁起就用兴奋剂成瘾了。

Sentence.sentence: Steamships captured the North Atlantic passenger business from sail in the 1840s because of its much greater speed.
The high cost of steam and the lesser need for speed kept the majority of the world's ocean freight moving by sail until the early years of the 20th century
If you could move at the speed of light, your time would stand still.
In the old days, we didn't much write like talking because there was no mechanism to reproduce the speed of conversation.

If the collapse of the rain forests speeds up dramatically,it could eventually release 3.5-5 billion metric tons of carbon into the atmosphere each year - making forests the leading source of greenhouse gases.
To increase the volume and the speed with which we move natural resources through the consumer economy to the junk pile or the waste heap.

sentences.en: Our speed averaged out at 50 km an hour.
sentences.cn: 我们的平均速度是每小时50公里。

sentences.en: Everyone was surprised by the speed with which the dispute was settled.
sentences.cn: 每个人都为这一争端解决得如此之快而感到吃惊。

sentences.en: He sped his car through the street.
sentences.cn: 他开车飞速地穿过街道。
警官, 我真的超速行驶了吗?

jushi.english: The Marathoner ran at an average speed at the beginning of the race.
jushi.chinese: 那位马拉松运动员开始时以中速赛跑。

jushi.english: We were moving at different speeds.
jushi.chinese: 我们以不同的速度前进。

jushi.english: The car must have gone into the side of the house at a tremendous speed.
jushi.chinese: 那辆汽车准是以惊人的速度撞上了房子的侧面。
